abstract: Banks’ out-of-control risk-taking and the government’s failure to rein them in created many problems, which critics of government spending are now using as an excuse to attack Medicare, an economist writes.
snippet: Banks’ out-of-control risk-taking and the government’s failure to rein them in created many problems, which critics of government spending are now using as an excuse to attack Medicare, an economist writes.
lead_paragraph: Simon Johnson is the Ronald A. Kurtz Professor of Entrepreneurship at the M.I.T. Sloan School of Management and co-author of “White House Burning: The Founding Fathers, Our National Debt, and Why It Matters to You.”
